intro: Syngonanthus tricostatus, commonly known as the three-costate mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaceae. It grows on the branches of host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and clustered in small inflorescences. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains seeds covered in a sticky substance to aid in attachment to host plants.
